ManSection.Description: We suppose that I and J are ideals in the algebra A. Returns the algebra bimodule in which the algebra A/I acts on the bimodule I/J.
Returns the acting algebra of the algebra bimodule M.
Returns the algebra that is acted upon in the algebra bimodule M.
Returns the left action in the algebra bimodule M.
Returns the right action of the algebra bimodule M.

A is an algebra. Returns the automorphism group of A. Note that this function is only for experimenting and only computes the automorphism group if either A is very small (in this case it checks all linear transformations) or A is the trivial algebra in which all products are zero (in this case the automorphism group is GL(A)).
M is an algebra bimodule. Returns the group of compatible pairs.
M is an algebra bimodule. Returns true if x is a compatible pair of the algebra bimodule M.
